009
010package imagingbook.common.threshold.global;
011
012import imagingbook.common.histogram.HistogramUtils;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * This is an implementation of the global thresholder proposed by Kapur et al. in [1].
017 * See Sec. 9.1.5 (Alg. 9.5) of [2] for a detailed description.
018 * </p>
019 * <p>
020 * [1] J. N. Kapur, P. K. Sahoo, and A. K. C. Wong. A new
021 * method for gray-level picture thresholding using the entropy of the
022 * histogram. Computer Vision, Graphics, and Image Processing 29, 273â€“285 (1985).
023 * <br>
024 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 
025 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
026 * </p>
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 * @version 2022/08/21
030 */
031public class MaxEntropyThresholder implements GlobalThresholder {
032        
033        static final double EPSILON = 1E-16;
034        
035        private double[] S0 = null;
036        private double[] S1 = null;
037        
038        public MaxEntropyThresholder() {
039                super();
040        }
041        
042        @Override
043        public int getThreshold(int[] h) {
044                int K = h.length;       
045                double[] p = HistogramUtils.pdf(h);                     // normalized histogram (to probabilities)      
046                makeTables(p);  // initialize S0, S1
047                
048                double P0 = 0;  // cumulative probability
049                
050                int qMax = -1;
051                double Hmax = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
052                
053                for (int q = 0; q <= K-2; q++) {                
054                        P0 = P0 + p[q]; 
055                        if (P0 < EPSILON) continue;             // empty histogram so far, nothing to do
056                                
057                        double P1 = 1 - P0;
058                        if (P1 < EPSILON) break;                // no more histogram entries, finished
059                        
060                        // P0, P1 are nonzero!                  
061                        double H0 = -S0[q]/P0 + Math.log(P0);
062                        double H1 = -S1[q]/P1 + Math.log(P1);
063                        double H01 = H0 + H1;           
064                        
065                        if (H01 > Hmax) {
066                                Hmax = H01;
067                                qMax = q;
068                        }               
069                }
070
071                return qMax;
072        }
073        
074        // pre-calculate tables S0 and S1
075        private void makeTables(double[] p) {
076                int K = p.length;               
077                S0 = new double[K];             
078                S1 = new double[K];             
079
080                // S0[q] = \sum_{i=0}^{q} p[i] * \log(p[i])
081                double s0 = 0;
082                for (int q = 0; q < K; q++) {
083                        if (p[q] > 0) {
084                                s0 = s0 + p[q] * Math.log(p[q]);
085                        }
086                        S0[q] = s0;
087                }
088                
089                // S1[q] = \sum_{i=q+1}^{K-1} p[i] * \log(p[i])
090                double s1 = 0;
091                for (int q = K-1; q >= 0; q--) {
092                        S1[q] = s1;
093                        if (p[q] > 0) {
094                                s1 = s1 + p[q] * Math.log(p[q]);
095                        }
096                }
097        }
098}
